PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
The Process Hazards Analysis, conducted on April 13, 2023, provided mitigation measures to improve safety at the NewCold facility. The NewCold safety committee is planning to complete several items over the next year, as a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for their employees. These changes include the following items:
1. Continue to train all employees in the facility safety plan/programs.
2. Continue to have employee involvement in safety plan development.
3. Continue employee involvement through safety team participation.
4. Continue internal and external safety audits/inspections and implement changes as needed.

ontractor is hired for major repairs or maintenance. The facility including the ammonia system was designed and constructed in accordance with the Uniform Mechanical Code applicable at the time of construction, which specifically outlines requirements for the safe operation of the ammonia refrigeration system. These safety features include ammonia sensors in the engine room and in refrigerated spaces. In addition, the majority of the ammonia is maintained inside the engine room and just outside of the engine room (condensers). All pressure vessels are equipped with pressure relief valves. All of the relief valves are tied into a common relief header that vents to the Diffusion Tank, except for the oil pot, which vents back into the Low Pressure Receiver.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
The NewCold facility has not had any recordable accidents since it's start up in 2017.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
The NewCold facility has an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) in effect and will respond defensively to ammonia leaks up to 300 ppm. The facility's EAP is coordinated with the Tacoma Fire Department. This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:
1.) To save lives.
2.) To minimize and avoid injuries.
3.) To protect the environment.
4.) To minimize property damage.
The operator of the facility maintains a safety committee whose members are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility. The plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures, which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility. This plan is reviewed and updated to ensure ongoing compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations.

In case of an ammonia emergency, the facility plans to evacuate all employees and contractors and activate the facility's response plan to respond to the situation. If necessary, they will alert the local emergency responders (fire department)

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES
NewCold - Tacoma (NewCold) management is not only committed to offering superior service, but also to maintaining a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities. NewCold's safety and environmental policies are administered by the QESH Manager and Operations & Warehouse Manager, who conducts periodic inspections of the facility to ensure compliance, and oversees the entire safety and environmental programs, including the PSM/RMP Program.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE
The NewCold facility is located at 4601 South Orchard Street, Tacoma, Washington.  The facility is approximately 1.84 miles west of Interstate 5 and approximately 1.3 mile south of Highway 16.  The area immediately surrounding the facility is urban, with a mixture of mostly industrial and commercial areas. The regulated material present at the facility and the focus of this study is anhydrous ammonia.  The facility uses a maximum of 14,000 pounds of ammonia as a refrigerant within a closed system. The system, consisting of piping, valves, and equipment, cycles ammonia through various physical states (high pressure liquid, low pressure liquid, low pressure vapor, high pressure vapor, then back to high pressure liquid) in order to provide refrigeration for the cold storage of food products. Typical operating conditions range from 0 psig on the low pressure side of the system to 190 psig on the high side.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS
The NewCold ammonia refrigeration system has many safety features. Much of the safety of the system is inherent in the policies and procedures that govern the operation of the system. For example, the facility operates in accordance with OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation.
